name: cob
content:
cob noun [C]
(CORN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the hard cylinder-shaped part of the maize plant on which the yellow or white grain grows: Cut the corn kernels from the cob. See also
corn on the cob
Roger Phillips/Dorling Kindersley/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesIndian corn can be left on the cob for the birds to peck.Ethanol can be made from discarded cobs, a by-product of corn processing.You need sweetcorn - 2 freshly boiled cobs.

cob noun [C]
(HORSE)
a strong horse with short legs: One of my early memories is riding a cob called Rufus.
Zuzule/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

cob noun [C]
(BIRD)
a male swan: A cob will attack anything that threatens his pen and their cygnets. Compare
pen
Ben Queenborough/Oxford Scientific/GettyImages

cob noun [C]
(BREAD)
UK a small round loaf of bread: I bought some butter and a crusty cob.
zeleno/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

abbreviation for close of business: the end of the working day or the business day: Submissions to the discussion paper from all interested parties are due by COB on 18 January .
More examplesFewer examplesThe latest information available as at COB 11 May 2020 is that the following port facilities are not operating.The changing of close of business into C. O. B. is just one example of how a common phrase or idea is now an acronym or in some cases, a new word.I need to get this back to her by COB Monday.The table shows a relatively simple trade using the stock and a single put option contract (prices at COB 26/7).
